description:
Really tasty burger on crisp, toasted ciabatta. I added on avocado and brie and they were very generous with both. Burger was cooked perfectly. The waiter asked if I wanted salad "or" fries but it ended up coming with both. I especially liked the side salad, which had a surprisingly savory and warm mouthfeel. The fries were solid and came with an AMAZING garlic aioli. 

Attentive service. We came here at around 8PM on Wednesday and there were several tables available. Lots of people were getting buckets of "moules" (mussels) and I'd love to come back and try them.
author: Victoria S.

description:
This is my third visit. Very cute warm atmosphere. My first visit was dinner after the opera. A night doesn't get much better than that. Right now it is a bit difficult to serve me because I am on the Keto diet. The servers were very gracious and understanding of what I needed and made the substitutions I needed 

On our first visit we sat in Alexandra's section. What a great experience. Just got back from Paris in June and eating here makes me feel like I never left. On our second visit Adam was our server. Adam did not disappoint either.  I would definitely ask to set in their sections. 

The steak with the caper mustard sauce is my new favorite. Yes even on Keto. The lamb and harissa is another favorite. The crispy Brussels sprouts are very good. I do the green beans with my steak being I can't eat potatoes. 

My partner had the duck confit and potatoes. He says it was excellent and the potatoes are to die for. The pork was absolutely delicious. 

I hope everyone will enjoy this little gem as much as we do. I work in the industry and after my 3 trip in two weeks, I will look forward to my fourth.
author: Tony C.

description:
4+ stars... Twice we were in San Francisco for a concert and ended up here, both times it was excellent!!!! The first time I had a wonderful pork chop, a friend got the chicken and another got the steak. Not only was it made perfectly, it was affordable.

The second time I ordered the duck confit, with scalloped potatoes and green beans in a balsamic reduction, absolutely amazing! My girlfriend got the Sea Bass and another friend go the salmon... Great food at a reasonable price.

The waitress was so nice and had a beautiful French accent, Will definitely be back soon!
author: Phil B.

description:
I love a French bistro menu. Whenever there are mussels on a menu I get them.
I got the mariniere mussels with fries and my friends got the Mac and cheese and the fettuccini carbonara. All of us were very happy with our food. The garlic aioli was a highlight as well as the mussels. These mussels were extremely well flavored and there was free bread to soak up all the broth at the end. At about $15-20 an entree and $40 for a bottle of wine, this is a great place for a dinner where you want to feel fancy but not dress up or pay that extra premium. The ambiance is very Parisian cafe, a little tight and bustling. There is usually a significant wait on the weekend given the limited seating and popular demand.
author: Sharvari J.

description:
Average burger according to my brother who wanted to wait the half hour just to try what he read would be one of the best Bay area burgers.

Not sure if he was reading Yelp or what, but I already told him not to have his hopes up since I've had their burgers before here and at their other restaurant.

I felt the escargot was dry and chewy and their onion soup was a bit too salty.

3 stars for average. In my opinion bot worth the half hour wait for this place as well.
author: Jack R.

description: I love this quaint French bistro (and Hayes Valley in general). Perfect spot for lunch or brunch on a sunny day. The photos attached are from brunch but I highly recommend their steamed mussels and fries with aioli. The cafe is small so there could be a wait-- no worries though because it's situated right next to some of the best shops in the city.
author: Sara S.

description: Hello Chez Maman. I had built up Chez Maman in my head because of its listing on Yelp, and it really wasn't a big deal after all. They have burgers for $13, crepes for $13, and paninis for $12. Take your pic any day of the week. I went for the salmon crepe and the salmon was good. The crepe was a new kind of brown crepe I didn't understand and didn't really like. But it was worth a try, and I would come back. I would have a burger or panini. It's not that expensive for these kinds of menu items. The free bread was good and I had a lemonade(of course). I was by myself. I realized the space is pretty small and doesn't seem to hold that many people in the restaurant, which I figured was like a cafe that wasn't in North Beach. I don't see how you can come here with a big group. It's for a couple of people(maybe 4). It wasn't a high-end dining experience. It's like a North Beach tourist spot. But in Hayesssss Valllleeeeyy.
author: Denise C.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in Hayes Valley (which is saying a lot since there are so many amazing restaurants there)! Every time I go, I get the truffle fries w/ aioli, mussels, and a glass of riesling. Honestly, it's perfect and I leave super satisfied. 
I've tried both the french onion soup and beef tartare appetizers and they are so freakin good as well!
author: Alex C.

description:
A great place for dinner before the Opera or Symphony, just two and a half blocks away.

It is a smaller sized establishment, so we were lucky when we walked in and got the last table.  We told them we had a limited amount of time before the Opera (it was Wagner, so it started earlier than normal) and the waiter guided us to some items that were quicker to prepare. 

I had the Veal with a creamy white wine sauce ($20) and my son had the Bass ($20).  Both were delicious and were indeed quickly prepared.  I tasted the Bass, and while it was very good, the Veal (and especially the delicious sauce!) was fantastic.  The service was efficient. 

We even had time for cappuccino ($3.75) after dinner. 

We will be back!
author: Mike M.

description:
Cute little corner French restaurant. A limited number of tables so there will usually be a wait. Put your name down and explore the many cute stores in the area. 

Got the Salmon Burger which was stuffed with two decently sized filets. Comes with some fixins, a side salad, and fries. A pretty good deal for only $13. 

Definitely want to come back and try some of their classic French dishes!
author: Courtney N.

description:
Overview: Chez Maman (pronounced Shay Mama) in Hayes Valley, San Francisco, is a one of two Chez Maman restaurants (the other being in Potrero Hill) that serves burgers and non-pretentious French cuisine at "average San Francisco" prices in a small establishment with options for both indoor and outdoor seating. 

The Food: I've had their standard Angus burger with an egg, the veal, steak tartare, and their striped bass here, and found all to be great dishes and decent values in this incredibly overpriced city. 

Firstly, their burger is an absolute delight - cooked medium-rare with a runny egg yolk dripping over what I assume is a house-made bun, it hits the spot despite being incredibly expensive for a burger ($16 including egg and a slice of provolone). 

The veal isn't particularly unique but the pricing at $20 is very reasonable given that their cheese burger + egg is $16. 

The steak tartare at $17 is pretty pricey for the relatively small serving size but is prepared well and I did not experience any unexpected bathroom issues in the following days.

The striped bass is also not particularly delicious or unique but was prepared well and without unexpected bones or off-smells.

The Service: Expect to wait a lot here but when they do come, the servers are very pleasant and friendly.

The Establishment: This is a very small restaurant and would not be appropriate for anyone handicapped or for children with strollers unless you want to eat outside. The outside patio is usable if you sit on the inside edge because of their large heat lamps but you sit on the further side, you will likely be uncomfortable when the wind hits. With its prime location on Hayes St right in the heart of Hayes Valley, this place is consistently packed so this scenario where outside seating is open but the inside is packed is encountered more than you would expect.

Conclusions: Chez Maman does mostly everything right and it wasn't so cramped inside, the burger wasn't $16, and some of their main dishes had some unique twists, it would hands down get 5-stars from me.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Amazing food, amazing service, amazing environment --what more can I ask for? I have already been to their Potrero Hill location before and loved this place, so it was no surprise that they would continue to meet my expectations.

On a Tuesday evening, we waited an hour at 7:30pm for a table of 4. Considering the fact that the restaurant is pretty tiny, there were only about four larger tables, so I'd recommend coming here with only two --perfect date night spot. They even have some cute outdoor seatings if it's not too chilly out.

Our table started off with their special Les Moules ($16) with a side of Fries ($6). For the les moules, there's four different flavors to choose from. We opted for Marinière, which consisted of garlic, white wine, lemon juice, and parsley. It's light, refreshing, and just a bit acidic. To be honest, I did not understand the fries recommendation with the les moules as our entire table enjoyed the fries on its own instead. The side of fries was also rather small and not even fully filled up, but the les moules was great nonetheless to share.

For my main dish, I tried the popular Chez Maman Basic Burger ($13) with Bacon ($1.50) and an Egg ($1.50). The additions definitely make this a pricey burger. I can see why this burger is highly rated as the patty is so freaking juicy and tender. They actually cooked it perfectly medium too! I also liked that I was able to get half salad and half fries with the burger for a good balance. The only thing I wasn't fond of was that the burger was on ciabatta bread.

Aside from the food, the thing that made Chez Maman stand out to me the most had to be their service. Since we waited an hour for our table, we were all starving by the time we sat down. We ended up going through five baskets of bread and probably ten cups of butter before our food came. The servers were so generous to continue to provide us with all our requests. When one person in our party asked for a lot of parmesan cheese, they weren't playing and gave her a huge bowl of it! Now that's what I call amazing service! It's like when the server shaves your cheese and asks you to tell them "when," but they just hand you the entire block of cheese.
author: Cindy Z.

description: Can't go wrong with the burger here. One of the more affordable French options in the city. They also have a location in Potrero Hill with a shorter time. However, last time I came on a Thursday at 7pm, we didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes.
author: Sophia L.

description: Stopped in here randomly for lunch after peeking at the menu as we walked by. Everything was great and the wait staff very friendly! The acme bread which is local to us is always a treat. Out of everything we had the Mac` and cheese was ok as it could have used a little something -just a little bland. We were so full after our appetizers that we barely saved room for the entrees! BUT there is ALWAYS room for affogato! Always a sucker and gets me every time! It's made with illy so it was a HUGE WIN!
author: Peaches H.

description:
My friend and I wanted to catch up, and since we met through a study abroad program in Paris, she thought this would be a cute brunch spot for us. She was right! 

Tip: For brunch, get there as soon as they open if you don't want to wait. The whole place was filled within 30 minutes after they opened. They don't take reservations, and the whole party needs to be present before you can get seated (I was the first one there and all the table was empty at this point, but I guess it's their policy). 

Food: The mussels, the fries, the crepe--everything was perfect. If they want to be "more authentic," the mussels really should come with the fries, especially at their price point. There are four or five different options for the mussels, and we went with one with white wine. Both of us were happy with our meal (and mimosa). The fries are just how I like it, perfectly crispy and served with garlic aioli. 

Service: The servers were extremely attentive despite how busy the store was.
author: Crystal K.

description: This place had delicious escargot!! We enjoyed a New York steak to go with it. The neighborhood was nice and the restaurant gives a nice view of people passing by. We will definitely be back!
author: Sam C.

description: This place is a 3.5 for food. Although the menu has a pretty varied selection, overall I find the food consistently bland. There's not a tremendous amount of flavor subtlety or taste. But it presents a nice option for French bistro food.
author: Liz S.

description:
My friends and I were in the area and wanted to find some food. The wait time for this place was quite long, but we ended up getting some drinks before coming back and our table came just in time! The place was a little small though so we were a bit cramped at times, but it made for a cozy feel and welcoming vibe.

I had the pork chop and it was delicious! The pork chop was made really well and was juicy and tender. The sauce it came in was rich and creamy while also being flavorful and not overbearing. Even the Brussel sprouts were good!

Overall it was a great meal and I enjoyed it quite a bit!
author: Tyler T.

description:
We went on a Friday evening and were lucky enough to get the last table outside. The restaurant isn't too big, but they make use of the space. Also, thank goodness for heat lamps! 

We decided to split the Thai mussels and a Basic Burger. All the flavors were amazing. The Thai flavors were creamy and the perfect level of spiciness. The burger doesn't look that special, but oh man, when you bite into it, it's juicy and flavorful.  Service was amazing and the food is delicious. I highly recommend!
author: Shera K.

description: If you plan on going on a weekend, be prepared to wait a long long time. They are usually very busy. I visited with a couple of my friends and we enjoyed our time. Good place for a hangover brunch on Sundays. We got a variety of dishes. I recommend their crepes and the one I got was the savoyarde. It's a savory crepe and pretty heavy on the stomach.
author: Julia J.

description:
A good friend of mine from NYC was visiting SF. And wanting to show the amazing food scene in SF, I decided Chez Maman might be a good pick. This restaurant is a bit cozy, and is located on the corner of Gough and Hayes Street. We went on a Sunday for lunch, and there was about a 20-30 minute wait. But since there was 3 of us, we were able to get a bigger table and were seated pretty quickly. If there's a bit of a wait, there are plenty of shops to keep you occupied nearby while waiting. 

The staff was great and was able to give good recommendations on the menu. They have a great selection of paninis, burgers, and crepes for the more cost affordable end. And if you want to splurge a bit, the mussels looked delicious along with the entrees. My friends ordered paninis, and I ordered a smoked salmon crepe. The crepe was made of buckwheat and it was quite yummy. The crepe came with a ton of spinach, shallots, fresh herbs, and creme fraiche sprinkled on top. It was delicious, although the smoked salmon seemed a tad bit too salty. 

It was overall a delicious meal and very cost affordable. A crepe was only $13 which is amazing in SF! I will definitely be visiting again :)
author: Jackie C.

description:
Came here around 8pm on a Thursday night, was told likely 45min but was seated within 15min. They have both outdoor and indoor seating - the tables are really close to one another.

My friend took me here because she loves the burger and fries, so that's exactly what I got. I ordered my burger with brie and they sure gave a generous amount :O. It was as basic as a burger could be, but still super juicy and flavorful, especially with the grilled onions. I personally did not like the ciabatta bread since it made the burger harder to eat.. I had to bite and pull almost every single time I bit into the burger. 

What I loved more than the burger were the FRIES. Perfectly crisp, salted, and paired with their homemade aioli. I can eat their fries all day.
author: Elvi T.

description:
Super good !
They do not take reservations but the wait might be long, but definitely worth it.

The food is great. The brussell sprouts are oily but yummy. Their heated Camembert cheese is amazing.
The veal dish was my favorite.

End it with a creme brûlée or a Nutella Crepe!
author: Jad A.

description:
Customer service from the moment you are greeted is excellent. I wouldn't think to grab a burger at a French restaurant but according to the reviews this is what i had to try. 

 I went with the Burger and added goat cheese (why not?) avocado and bacon. It comes on ciabatta bread and came out pretty quickly as others have noted.  The price was roughly $13 I believe before the add-ons. 

The burger was pretty good and a solid four star venue for me.
author: Rod M.

description:
Damn u SF for the long wait lines in the middle of the week. And love u SF for the happiness u bring in little bites of amazing food that u have to offer. 

This place, never fails to make me happy. Met up with some girlfriends on this rainy Wednesday nite.

We all had wine pre dinner.
Dinner was:
Escargot (excellent)
Muscles (multiple dishes and various sauces) (excellent)
Veal (OK)
Salmon (excellent)
And a bite of heaven on the side of each dish.
I love everything about this place! The casual ambiance, the semi dim non romantic friendliness of everything. This is a kind of place u come to when u feel like it is all gonna be alrite.
author: Mary N.

description: 5 stars for their amazing food and exceptional service! I might be biased because my favorite cuisine is French but their food is absolutely delicious! Plus this location is a little bigger than the other one with more seating options and less of a wait time. We had the escargot, steak tartare, mussels and French onion soup and each dish was something to rave about. I've previously tried their crepes, burger and goat cheese which were all delicious as well. Our waiter, Lionel, was also the best! He truly cared about his customers and had the best sense of humor ever! I will definitely be back as long as Lionel stays and the food is as amazing as it always is! :)
author: Alisa N.

description: Chez Maman West is a great restaurant in Hayes Valley around great shopping locations such as Rad+Stadler , Undefeated , etc. Chez Maman West has an awesome mom and pop vibe but high end dining and great food . The outdoor seating is amazing with great SF weather while enjoying your food . I ordered the Half roasted organic chicken , garlic mashed potatoes , lemon confit , lemon jus and it was nothing short of amazing !
author: Corie G.

description: Love the French onion soup! Also would recommend the baked Camembert and fries with aioli. I've had the smoked salmon crepe and it is okay. Pretty light meal. Everyone who works here is extremely friendly!
author: Lillian B.

description:
Mussels w/ fries (in Thai sauce) is what you can not miss from here. The rest of the food is good too and the staff are pleasant. Quite a wait but quickly
find the list hanging right next to the door and leave your number ... a quick stroll around the street will occupy the wait.
author: E U.

description: Burger was fantastic with garlic aioli, carmelized onion, and tomato slices Side salad was light and plenty  Bread served was fresh!
author: Alex G.

description:
I had the basic burger here and it was pretty good! They actually have a lot of selection of burgers, which was surprising since I thought this would be a high-end fancy french restaurant, that's what it kind of felt like when you walked in. The service was pretty good and everybody was friendly. We sat at the bar because it was pretty packed, the place is a bit small and it's in the center of Hayes Valley at the corner of an intersection.

The basic burger was pretty solid and simple, it also came with a lot of fries so this dish was pretty filling. I would definitely come back and try some of their other dishes.
author: Christopher L.

description: I was really craving mussels and this spot popped up in my search. It's a small and classic French cafe style restaurant that's a little gritty but had lovely food. I went with the mussels in garlic and white wine which came in this large pot. In fact, they gave a generous pour of the Chardonnay I ordered with it as well. The broth was pretty shallow but the mussels were great!
author: Jen L.

description:
A nice little French bistro! I love the ambience here everything is so intimate and loving. We sat at the three people table in the corner and absolutely enjoyed watching the street view from the window.

The escargots is my favorite dish! The garlic pesto sauce is so rich and flavorful! We kept ordering bread to soak off all the juice in the pan. The salad is huge and great for sharing. We also got a ham and cheese crepes however would probably skip it considering there are so much more to try on the menu! Brussels sprouts is mediocre.
author: Crystal S.

description:
Perpetually busy due to its prime Hayes Valley cornerfront location and its proximity to theaters, Chez Maman serves dependable, French-inspired bistro fare.

Whether it's a heap of moules frites, a crepe, or a burger, everything is beyond typical pub or restaurant fare, but not inaccessible, stuffy, or overpriced either. Despite the consistent business this place gets, service is generally on point, and Taylor, a hostess from a while back, was especially engaging and proactive in managing the line and giving updates on when tables might open up. A particularly good choice if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I love Chez Maman both at the Potrero location and this one. Their service is always top notch and non pretentious. The food is on point and always consistent. 

I love their Croque Madame as well as the Moules with white wine shallot sauce. So delicious!!  I heard they also cater weddings, not sure if that's the case anymore.
author: Kay H.

description: A cute little restaurant in Hayes Valley! My friend and I shared the beef tartare for an appetizer and it was delicious - perfect combination with the toasted bread. We got two orders of mussels - poulette and the mariniere. Both were delicious, but I would recommend poulette; the creaminess with the bacon flavor and bacon bits was absolutely divine. I also got the garlic mashed potatoes, I'd definitely recommend this side, it was perfectly seasoned and paired wonderfully with my mussels!
author: Stacy L.

description:
I'm a big fan of the food here and have been a customer here for many years (since I moved to Hayes Valley in 2012). This past weekend I wanted to take my parents here for dinner, so I put our name on the list. They said the wait would be 45 min. 

An hour and 20 min later they tell me they have a table for three. It is a table for two, with a third chair next to a huge pole that covers 1/3 of the long side of the table. I'm not sure how three plates would fit on the table. The table is also in front of the door. 

When I say we won't sit there, instead of telling us we can wait for a different table they shrug and say we can leave. It's that table or no table. No ability to wait more for a decent table. It was pretty terrible to have to find a new place to eat after 1 hr 20 min of waiting (on a Saturday night). I had also been checking in with the host as the wait got longer and longer. He even said at an hour 15 that we had to wait longer and then magically this terrible table is our only option. At this point, I can't say I'd be back. The food is good, but it's not worth this kind of service or experience.
author: Hanna L.

description:
Great service and cute little place. The food is solid!

If you want to take a bit of time with the food, I will ask the waiter to course it a bit, given that the food comes out at lightning speed here. 

The Hachi parmentier (French version of Shepard's pie, not as heavy as the english version) is excellent here. I used to have it all of the time in Paris and this is as good as the ones that I had in Paris. The flavor is right on with soft mashed potatoes and ground beef. The cheese on top added a creamy texture. 

Mussels mariniere is solid. 

Brussel sprouts are pretty good but a bit over fried for my taste.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
I dream about the goat cheese salad I had here. Arugula, caramelized onions and a huge chunk of fried goat cheese right on top, all tossed in a light balsamic vinaigrette - it was absolutely delicious. 

Only down side to this place was I felt like they had a fruit fly problem (common in SF) and was paranoid it would get lost the jungle that was my salad!

Otherwise, definitely going back.
author: Maansi D.

description:
Hayes Valley is known for some of there amazing bars and restaurants since it's located not to far from the SF Ballet, Symphony, and Theater. So how did I come across this place? Well I was on my way to the theater to see Aladdin (which was amazing) and needed a good bite to eat and a drink so what better place to pick.

This place is located on a corner it's pretty small but also very popular. They have some outdoor seating, and the waitlist happens to be outside as well (all members of the party must be with you before they seat you) thankfully we got seated pretty fast, and the service was fast as well. We sat next to the window which was nice because I like to people watch... not sure why? But I just do. Are waiter I believe was French, which kinda blew my mind because French restaurant and authentic French waiter.... um can we order him too? He was very polite and gave us water and a basket of
French bread while we looked through the menu. This place has an AMAZING menu and variety of bites all people can enjoy. We ordered a nice glass of Sauvignon blanc. The wine was perfect, dry just how I like it. Then the food came, an Ahi Tuna Niçoise salad along with a lamb sausage and Brie cheese melted panini that came with a simple salad. The Ahi was seared perfectly, fresh vegetables, great dressing, plump tomatoes, just an amazing salad and the Brie and Lamb sausage panini? Omg decadent. This place was just super satisfying.... I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the items on the menu, looking forward to hopefully trying the steak frites next!
author: Courtney S.

description:
Good, but not great. Ate here recently with friends.

On food:
(1) Les Moules (Poulette) with fries: The flavor was nice, but it seemed a bit watery and the texture was so-so. The dish overall was a good deal because of the large bowl, but individually they were small. Also, the fries were thin cut and crispy, but dry.
(2) 100% Angus Beef Burger: The burger was slightly disappointing. I love thicker burgers cooked medium/medium-rare, but the patties here were on the thinner side and cooked to medium-done.

On service: The front hostess was helpful, and our waitress was super sweet! 

On location: Lastly, the location is on a beautiful block of Hayes Valley and the interior is cozy, but the chairs were uncomfortable and was seated at a table in the back corner near the restrooms.

Would come back due to the location, service, and other good reviews, and would try different dishes.
author: Michelle B.

description:
There's a reason why I keep coming back. This place is the best French restaurant in the City (in my own humble opinion, of course). My mom loves it. My friends love it. My fellow Yelpers love it. Everyone loves it.

What do I like the most at Chez Maman? The crêpes! Get them! They taste as good as the ones I used to eat when I was once a young innocent child back in Paris. Just a footnote, I'm mostly talking about the savory ones, usually called "galettes." Whenever I come here, whether with friends or family, I always order a Beef Tartare and some Escargots de Bourgogne (aka snails) for appetizers to share. I would recommend trying these dishes out instead of getting a classic French Onion soup. Other dishes I would suggest trying: Hachis Parmentier, the Veal, and the Moules Marinière.

Service is exemplary. It's always nice to talk to some French people whenever you come here. It allows me to become a little more bougie, you know...

And don't forget, finis ton assiette! Which mean "clean up your plate" if you did not know...
author: Alex L.

description:
First, I want to say their customer service is impeccable. After I posted my unhappy review, I received an immediate follow-up saying I know we can do better, and we would love to have you come back in any time. So, I went last w/ a friend and we had the best meal. I'm still stuffed this morning. We started our meal off with escargot, les moules, and fries. We ate every last mussel. It was the first time I've tried escargot and I'm wondering where have you been all my life?!?! YUM! The wine sauce for the mussels was DELICIOUS & perfect for dipping my fries and bread in (hint: keep the bread at the table for dipping). Then, we shared an entree. We had the pork chop with Brussels sprouts and the sauce on the pork chop was also delicious. It was apple cider mustard sauce which I also utilized for bread dipping. I started my meal with a red wine and moved onto a Bellini. We finished our meal with my friend's salted caramel gelato and my passionfruit sorbet in champagne. Every single thing was truly delicious. I'm so glad I was invited back... I had a feeling my experience was a fluke. I can say I am beyond pleased and look forward to coming back and bringing other friends too. 

The entire time the staff was attentive yet not intrusive. Really it was perfect.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Solid brunch and dinner spot. Can't go wrong. This time I got the omelet and it was good. Too much egg compared to meat and vege ratio. The tiny potatoes were nice and so was the salad. 

There was surprisingly no wait for a party of 2 on a Sunday afternoon. Though the space is pretty cramped inside. Generally we like to go to the Potrero location but this place is centrally located so that's nice.
author: Young Y.

description:
Very, very, very mediocre French bistro inspired food.

The steak tartare was good. Depending on your taste, it could use a bit more Dijon, maybe salt.

The Cesar salad was alright and super basic. I've had better at Revelry Bistro (theirs is AMAZING). They drenched the salad in sauce and the lettuce seemed a bit old.

Moules frites (aka mussels and fries) in white wine sauce was pretty underwhelming. The sauce / broth was missing a lot flavor. Needed a lot of salt. The fries were sad too.

Croque monsieur was mehhhh too. They use cheap lunch meat (the one that's shaped like a rectangle) and it wasn't crunchy as I hoped it be. It was drowning it cheese, very little meat, and crust was soft.

I think the appeal here is that they have outdoor seating which is nice on a (rare) hot day and it's location is in the middle of Hayes Valley.

If you really want good French bistro food, there are plenty other in SF (like revelry bistro, not too far away either).
author: T L.

description:
Really wanted to love Chez Maman, but the dishes we ordered fell short. 

Beef tartare and mussels were fine, but not great. 

Mac 'n cheese had way, way, WAY too much truffle oil.

Did not get a chance to try the escargot (they ran out), but unlikely to return based on the other dishes.  :(
author: Christine A.

description: INCREDIBLE gruyere mac and cheese. My friends ordered the salmon and the veggie crepe which were also delightful. Only reason for four stars is that service was a little off. We were offered a tiny table for three people and had to ask to be moved to one that made more sense. Will definitely be back to try more dishes here!
author: Manuela R.

description:
Office's Friday's Free Lunch chose this place again.. and I'm definitely keeping my 1 star rating because the Veal has more grease than if I were to get an Oil change. The "veal" is soaking in an oil bath. I doubt it's real veal. The meat actually looks like the thin slices of meat you get from shabu shabu . The mushroom cream sauce tastes like its from Campbell's Mushrooms sauce. Everyone can make this.
Ingredients : Thin slices of beef, Campbell's mushrooms sauce, assorted vegetables, and a 5 quarts of synthetic oil.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Great food with fast and friendly service. 

In the area looking for an amazing crepe? Recently turned vegetarian? The mushroom crepe is absolutely delicious. I would also highly recommend the French onion soup. 

(Excuse my half eaten crepe)
author: Tori L.

description:
Once upon a time, when I was a young and innocent college student, I spent a semester studying abroad in Paris. And this forever spoiled me for French cuisine and all staples thereof (baguettes, macarons, croissants and especially chocolate). Since then I have been a lost soul wandering the so-called French restaurants and bakeries of America from the East Coast to the West in search of truly authentic French cuisine that is reasonably priced. 

This place is it. It's a charming and intimate setting with wonderful service and great food. It's menu is full of the classics you'd find in a Parisian brasserie and the quality is excellent for the price. I highly recommend.
author: Dulma T.

description:
Fantastic Food. Fantastic Service. 

I could gush on this review because there was so much to love. On our waitress' recommendation, I started with the french onion soup. It was phenomenal. A wonderful precise mix of cheese, onion and the broth was not overly salty as I have had before. 

The main course for me was the pork chop, again on recommendation from our waitress. This may have been the best pork chop I have ever had. The sauce was spectacular, the veggies great, the meat was cooked perfectly and tender. I can't wait to go back. 

We also sat at the bar which was lovely. The service didn't suffer at all. They also have outdoor seating which would be wonderful on a warm night.
author: John W.

description:
Came here on a Saturday with a friend in the afternoon for late lunch at 2 pm. All their outdoor seating was taken so we sat inside :) I think we waited may be like 10 min. Also came here on a Tuesday night for dinner at 8 and waited a full hour before being seated so just fair warning. This place is popular! 

I love, love the French onion soup here! It's so flavorful and rich, by the end you feel full (didn't even order an entree because I was so full). 

For lunch, My friend and I ordered crepes but I think we both felt they were kind of under filled! Still delicious regardless. For dinner, my friend order the pork chop with Brussels sprouts and bacon with this delicious sauce! It was $17 but the portion is quite large and the pork is so juicy!! I generally like if the Brussel sprouts are a bit more crisp(seemed soft and buttery) but it was still great with the bacon. Recommend it! 

Service here is also nice, they stopped by our table to give us multiple water refills and ask us if we needed anything. 

Will be back for the soup another time and to try some of their other dishes!!
author: Kristie M.

description:
I was in the area exchanging something and my partner and I decided to eat here. We were afraid there would be a long line since it was lunch time but to our fright we were able to snag two seats at the bar. The restaurant itself is really small so I was glad we didn't have to wait. 

We ordered the escargot, mussels with fries, and he carbonara. The escargot was so good, especially when eaten with the complimentary bread. The mussels were ok. Fries were good. I really liked the aioli that came with the fries. The carbonara was also delicious. Portions were good. 

Service is attentive. Parking can be hard to find in the area. Takes card and cash.
author: Tommy L.

description:
What a great, quaint spot for a mid week retreat.  We arrived at 5:30 and had a 25 min wait to sit at the bar but no problem, well worth the wait. 

I started with the endive salad and my son went had the warm goat cheese salad. Both were outstanding.  For our main course my son had the pork chop with Brussels sprouts and I had the large order of Beef Tartare. The chop was at least 3/4 lb, well prepared without being dry. It was served with bacon fried Brussels sprouts and a light white wine reduction. Outstanding.  The Beef Tartare was an excellent grade of meat, all of the typical ingredients with a little extra relish. Also outstanding. 

All of this for $66 (tax included). 

Don't miss it!
author: Mike J.

description: The food here is amazing. After having an evening at the Cal Academy of Sciences we settled on this place for dinner per my cousins suggestion. We got a really cozy triangular table by the window. It was four of us & the table was perfect. We had wonderful food basically ordered 2 appetizers; 4 meals with 2 sides & two desserts with wines for all of us. The food was really tasty nothing disappointed! The Thai mussels with the broth is very flavorful but not over powering. My salmon was cooked to perfection crispy on the outside & soft on the inside! My sister got the pasta & the sauce was perfect. The service here though is really bad. The guy dropped off the food & disappeared until we flagged him down to fill our water cups. Then again we flagged him down for the dessert menu & he looked like he didn't want to be bothered. The place is really cute & food is delicious they just need to work on their customer service because if your food is good & service is bad that can turn into a negative experience.
author: Zaro A.

description:
Great food and service! It was my first time at this location, located on a busy corner in lovely Hayes Valley. I arrived Saturday night at 6 pm and there was already a long waitlist line. I was by myself amongst a sea of couples and friend groups, and luckily they were able to seat me within 10 minutes of my arrival (perhaps they felt sorry for my lonely ass). Either way the service was fast and friendly and the food was wonderful as always.  I ordered French onion soup, mariniere mussels with wine, parsley and lemon, apricot chardonnay sorbet, and a cappuccino. Filled up on bread and butter. Everything was delicious and I wished I had room for their fries. Mussels are pretty good for the bay area, although I am spoiled by mussels I have had from Europe. I also felt the seasoning could have been a little stronger, perhaps a bit more salt and lemon juice. 

I can't wait to take myself out on another date, especially if it means skipping the line! (I'm not saying I would turn down a regular date and wait for a table, it's a little romantic getaway to France in the middle of the city)!
author: Susan W.

description: Have passed by this restaurant every week for the last year and it's always extremely busy on the weekends with a wait. We got a table outside and our server offered her recommendations. We ended up going for French onion soup, caricature plate, roast chicken, and moules et frites. Overall we really enjoyed everything. Being from Europe and having spent a lot of time in France it's always hard to not compare French cuisine in US to Europe. This came very close, five star service, tasty food and great prices.
author: Louisegreaney23 ..

description:
I did overall really enjoy it, if not slightly less than the East location. It's relatively cheap compared to other French style restaurants in SF. It took quite awhile to get our food on a slow day. However our waitress was super sweet and the owner was as well and they did apologize for the wait. 

-Croque Madamoiselle 3.5/5 - super cheesy and sweet, the proportion of smoked salmon to bread/cheese would of been better if it was just one slice of bread and cheese, the second layer is just so heavy. The flavor was great though, it was just far too rich to finish on my own. Side salad was a basic mixed greens, good portion and flavor. My boyfriends mother got the same thing and loved it, but agreed the amount of cheese was a bit much. 

-French Onion Soup 3/5 - similar cheese situation here, it's about 75% cheese to 25% broth. Again, flavors are great though. We all sort of picked at this together. 

Beef Tartare- 4/5 I loved this, but my boyfriend didn't like the dijon flavor too much. Light and sweet in what I thought, in a good way. We split this as well. 

I would definitely return, places at this price point is rare for what you get. maybe I'll just lay off the cheese laden items next time!
author: Tanya T.

description: So let me start off by saying "bravo"... this restaurant/manager/owner has got their business together!! Service: swift and professional+ knowledgeable server + superb cuisine= a bomb experience!! And they all help one another! They start you off with a basket of sliced crusty french bread which I used to sop us all the juicy deliciousness left over from the escargot I ordered; felt like I was back in Paris! The chicken panini was on point: two slices of buttery/crunchy bread filled with shredded chicken and pistou (pesto); served alongside mixed greens+radicchio all dressed in a simple vinaigrette---really liked how the acidity of the salad cut through the richness of the panini, nicely balanced!! Now let's talk about those fries; they must have been triple fried because they were so "daggone" crispy... I'd come just for them!! The 1664 off the tap was amazing: light, sweet, no aftertaste!! Best believe I'll be stopping in for another round!!
author: Jade L.

description: Came around 6:30 on a weeknight and by the time we were seated there was a line formed outside. I had the salmon with potatoes and creme fraiche and the chocolate mousse for dessert. Everything was delicious! I plan to return for a burger and fries!
author: L. W.

description:
Why Chez Maman? 

My best friend is in love with French cuisine, France, French - everything from Paris to Lyon to Marseille .. 
so on his birthday I looked up places to go to as his birthday celebration. Asked one of my foodie girl - Algerian lived in Paris before and she recommended Chez Maman on Gough str. One of her favorite. 

The thing that impressed the most is the way staff treating you here. You feel like home - like we have known each other previously, like you are one of the regular. That's the hard feeling to have when you step into a restaurant for the first time. 

The food is amazing. I have been to Paris & probably had some touristy French food but Chez Maman was phenomenal. 

We had the Salmon Panini - oh my god - so soft, so crunchy but still have the fully salmon taste. Parfait! 

Escargot is a MUST !!!!!! Pesto sauce is "orgasmic" 

Entree is Striped Sea bass with mango salsa - I'm in love. 

Including a glass of wine each & a scoop of ice-cream for dessert + tips: we paid $40 each since we were splitting entree'. So individual will probably go around $50 for 3 course meal with wine or around 30$ w/o. 

Sit outside and do people watching like real Parisians !!!
author: Thao P.

description:
Food is great -- the fries are especially good.
There is an on-site waitlist and you could only register after arrival, which I do not fancy much.
The place offered seats outside but it was very cold even with radiator on.
author: Michael T.

description:
Service is great. I love Hayes Valley, but food was not impressive, slightly overpriced and overrated. Compared to the other establishments around, Chez Maman does not break the bank, but for the taste of the food, I'd take a pass. The burger at Chez Maman in Potrero was one of the best burgers I've had, but Chez Maman West did not impress. 

Our party of 4 waited less than an hour for a table on the sidewalk. Not to worry, there are outdoor heaters for those brisk days. Eating dinner outside with French-accent waiters did somewhat bring me back to my times writing manuscripts and smoking cigarettes on the streets of Paris (kidding). 

I'll get right to it. Order the moules. Don't get anything vegetarian, especially not the veggie burger, which wasn't just bland but borderline gross. 

Come here for the ambiance, the hustle and bustle of Hayes Valley. The cramped, candlelit Parisian dinner that you long for. But don't expect the food to blow your mind.
author: Anthony G.

description:
Service here was so-so and it can easily feel as if you're having dinner with not just the person across from you, but also the people 3 inches to your left and right.

That being said, the food was EXCELLENT. Highly recommend the pork chop as it was pretty much divine.
author: William O.

description:
This restaurant was a great date night spot! I really enjoyed it for a number of reasons:
-It was cozy with nice dim lighting that made for an intimate dinner.
-They sat us immediately! That might have been because it was a Tuesday night, but it was still appreciated.
-Our waitress was incredibly nice and had an amazing French accent! She made sure we enjoyed both our meal and our drink and had great recommendations.
-The décor was very homey and the paintings all related to France in some way. It made for a unique experience.
-The food was incredible! We ordered the salmon panini and mushroom crepe. I highly recommend the mushroom crepe - it's very well done and filling.
-The wine was amazing! I had the Cabernet, which was the boldest on the menu. Definitely recommend it.
 
The only downsides were:
-The tables are very close together. It's hard to get to your seat if you're the one on the window side.
-My boyfriend's wine had a few pieces of cork in it - probably an honest mistake, but not appealing.
 
All in all, I'd definitely come back!
author: Remy B.

description: As I'm French, I wanted to try this place out for a while. Like the atmosphere - it's close to what you'd find in a Parisian bistro. I didn't try the mussels but they looked really good (just wish they'd come directly with fries). Had hachis parmentier. Was nice but there wasn't enough meat for my taste - too much cheese and mashed potatoes. Still, a cool option in the area!
author: Clémentine C.

description:
Chez Maman is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. It has delicious, simple French food! I have come here for brunch and dinner a few times, and I have never been let down. 

The restaurant is absolutely tiny- the wait could be very long if you come for brunch on a weekend or peak dinner hours on Friday or Saturday. However, if you come early, the wait won't be long at all. And even if you do have to wait, it's worth it! 

The fries with garlic aioli are a must. They are perfectly crispy, and the garlic aioli adds the perfect amount of flavor. The fettuccini is delicious, but on the heavier side. The savory crepes are also delicious- and even more so if you get an egg on top! The salmon nicose salad was also delicious and filling. Don't forget dessert! I would recommend the berry crepe with creme fraiche- not too sweet, but the perfect finale to any meal at Chez Maman.
author: Ayushi A.

description:
Chez Maman is our Go To Casual French Bistro.

We have been going to Chez Maman for years, and have probably had everything on the menu. It is a classic neighborhood bistro like many that you would find in Paris. Moules and Crepes are specialties. They have a nice chacuterie plate, steak tartar, duck confit, steak frites, merguez salad, baked Camembert...you get the idea. Nice, affordable wine list. Save room for the chocolate mousse -- it is outstanding.
author: John C.

description:
Due to persistent rudeness and shuffling of customers by the host/hostess Chez Maman has unfortunately lost it's appeal for me. I have enjoyed meals and the wait staff has been very nice. 
 
If you are waiting on a guest for lunch or dinner, you are not allowed to be seated, if you happen to sit at an empty table, waiting for your guest, you will be shuffled out.  Customers are never greeted. Its been fun over the many years, but this is a recurring theme each visit. With the amount of competition and new bistros everywhere my vote is to encourage all staff including bartenders and hostess to show consideration as opposed to arrogance and rudeness. Today would be my last visit.
author: shanti z.

description: Oh my gosh, when I remember the meals I've had here, I remember them as the best salad, the best mussels,the best mac and cheese I've ever had. Then months go by and when I go back,  I think,  "ok, this will be good,  but not as good as you remember. " but that is never the case! It's always BETTER than I remembered it! And the staff is so helpful,  happy,  attentive,  and proud of their food. Plus they always treat my disabled daughter like a queen.
author: Kim E.

description: The food was lovely, the service was great but the restaurant was SO LOUD! Husband had the duck confit special and I had a savory crepe. The side salad was huge!
author: Adrienne S.

description: Came here for desserts after work. We had the warm chocolate fondant, cinnamon pain perdu, and vanilla bean gelato at the waitress's suggestion. The fondant was rich, warm, and fudgy while the perdu was lighter and tasted like brioche crossed with French toast. The waitress also gave us an extra gelato with Nutella gratis. Will be back!
author: Catherine W.

description: This place is phenomenal! The beef tartare and French onion soup was to die for.  There is a huge wait for a Friday night, but it goes fairly fast and the food and service was completely worth it.
author: Laurel M.

description:
Eating a burger at a French restaurant is not something I expected to do, but I'm pretty glad I did.

Came around linner (after lunch, almost dinner time) and did not have to wait for a table, since there is seating outside as well. I would have preferred to sit inside as it was a little chilly out, but at least they have outdoor heaters. The woman who sat us was pretty nice. But no one really came around to check up on us during our stay to see if we wanted water refills or wanted to order anything else.

They have a good amount of options on their menu ranging from paninis to sandwiches, salads, to entrees. And crepes! My friend recommended the basic burger. I was originally going to get a panini, but apparently they don't let you swap out the salad for fries at all (even for an extra charge), so I went ahead and got the burger since that came with fries (fries is a must...always!). 

The burger was good! It came on ciabatta, which was different but really good. It also came with caramelized onions and mixed greens and tomatoes. The meat was thick and juicy. I asked for it medium rare, and it was cooked true to request. But what I really loved were the fries! No regrets backing out of the panini to get the burger otherwise I would've never been able to experience the fries. And the aioli. Oh my gosh. Garlic aioli came as a dip on the side of my meal. And I think it was already on the burger, but I still added some more on my burger because it made all the difference.

Under twenty bucks ($12 before tax/tip) for a quality meal? I say go for it
author: Meghan J.

description:
Came for lunch. $12 pre-tax, per-tip. Great bang for buck IMO. 

- FOOD (3.5 stars): tasty, melt in your mouth salmon served on ciabatta with a side of fresh mixed greens. Free french baguette served with all meals. Solid, though nothing particularly memorable.
- SERVICE (4 stars): great about continuously filling water, bread, etc. Very attentive. 

Outdoor seating available.
author: Kristie C.

description:
Cute little French place nestled in a corner in the bustling foodie section of Hayes Valley.. came in on a Sunday evening around 6, probably waited a bit over an hour for 2 seats as they don't take reservations (I wanted French onion soup THAT BADLY, yup). At least they take your number and call you once it's your turn to go in?

Finally after getting in, we were nestled in a cozy little corner at the bar. A little underwhelming as an outdoor seat or a table would've been nice after the long wait but alas didn't want to extend it. 

We ordered the Beef Tartare, French Onion Soup (!!!!), Basic Burger w. Cheese & Egg, and the Truffle Mac & Cheese. 

The beef was super tasty and fun to eat (first timer!), just a tad too salty but I guess that's the way it is when you eat out sometimes lol. French Onion Soup hit the spot, but came with such little soup and was incredibly salty. 

Basic Burger was pretty good but if you're a classic burger fan you may not necessarily enjoy this frilly burger on a non bun. I also felt it was very inconsistent in its seasoning so sometimes I was getting random kicks of flavor. However the FRIES were fantastic (coming from an avid potato fan). Now for the Truffle Mac & Cheese, I can't avoid things with cheese and truffle so ofc I had to try it. BUT I SHOULDVE TRUSTED THE YELP REVIEWS ON THIS. This was the biggest let down. I am all for loads of truffle oil but this mac & Cheese was ridiculously oily. I ate probably 15% of my dish and took the rest home where I microwaved it, soaked the oil, and ate it with a sandwich... Which attests to how it wasn't inedible but just not that great. 

ANYWHO, twas an interesting and somewhat nice experience to eat here, but I wouldn't come back. Nothing was horrible but nothing was great. That tis all.

the TL;DR
Food  (3/5)
Ambiance (3.5/5)
Service (2.5/5)
author: Sara S.

description: Great place to sit outside, do some people watching, and enjoy some killer French onion soup (seriously, it's so good). Menu is not overwhelming but still has a great variety of options. My server was very nice and I got my food super quick. I appreciated having a whole basket of bread and butter to myself too!
author: Meghan W.

description: Really cute French bistro. Everything we ordered was cooked perfectly and reminded me of being on the left bank. Really friendly staff. Great service. Nice casual ambiance.
author: Leslie W.

description:
Just as solid as the location in Potrero. I already knew they had good burgers, so I switched it up and got the french onion soup and the crepe complete. 

The french onion soup was good, but not amazing. I've always thought that AppleBees has good french onion and this was on that level. 

The crepe was flavorful, but I wish that they put more filling in it. It was kind of small tbh. 

Still, I love the food a Chez Maman. The Potrero location offers a better view and faces the sunlight in the morning; so I prefer that location, but as far as food goes the West location doesn't under-deliver.
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
When Bay Area friends stop expressing their understandable disdain for Trump they turn to their second favorite topic du jour, how San Francisco is changing.  So when I tell you that Chez Maman West feels a bit like San Francisco past, that's a compliment.  

Chez Maman West occupies a buzzy spot in Hayes Valley.  I've dined here a few times and tried to dine more than that but have been put off by the wait.  They do quite a business, turning many tables in a day.  This is generally not a place at which you can linger.   

The old-school feelings this place evokes arise from many avenues.  First, there's the space itself.  It's intimate but not fancy or cutting edge.  It's a busy bistro, like one might find in Paris, and it's not glammed up.  It's very comfortable and even solo diners should fit right in, taking a seat at the small bar.  

The menu itself is a throwback to simpler times.  Chez Maman West seems to be one of the few remaining places where you can put together a very filling meal for around $20 (before wine).  A basket containing sliced baguette and butter arrives on your table without you requesting it and their wine list features many by-the-glass reds, priced at only $8.    

While I usually opt for the excellent moules (mussels, $16) and a side of perfect frites (thin, salty, glorious french fries, $6) I ordered the Salade Nicoise ($16, with ahi or salmon; I chose ahi) on a recent visit and found it to be hugely satisfying.  This is a full-meal salad despite the fact that I also ordered the don't-miss frites to share.  

A Smoked Salmon Panini ($12, with salad accompaniment) was reported equally satisfying and, between the table bread, the frites, and the wine, half the Panini was taken home for a second meal.  That's something one rarely reports in the "new" San Francisco.

If you're looking for a place to eat good, well-priced, ample-portioned food while you bitch about Trump, Chez Maman West fits the bill.  Your second topic of choice may, however, crawl to the back-burner as you realize that there's still a few places out there that are keeping the SF of old alive.  

I like Chez Maman West.
author: Tracey A.

description:
My Husband and I were looking for a dining experience in SF during our visit without breaking our budget! OMG we were so happy to come across Chez Maman!  First of all, once we sat down we felt like we had taken a flight back to Paris.  It was so cozy, french music, even the patrons near us were all speaking French.. lovely waitress with French accent.. we were sold BUT then... 
OMG the food was just as surprising! Although they had run out of mussels for the night, bummer.. we tried the french onion soup ( yummy but a tad heavy for my liking, but then again what should I have expected), the burger (perfect), and the bass (lovely). The price point was reasonable considering we were in SF.  Overall were completely enjoyed out visit and if we are in the city again, this will definitely be on our list to return to.
author: Dahls B.

description: Sadly I have no pics to share only the remnants of a very satisfied experience. Our server was super friendly . The place is cozy tucked in the busy Hayes valley area . Granted we went for A late lunch on a Friday so parking was not horrible. But parking can be challenging on the busy days . I had their endive pear and goat cheese salad , steak and fries with peppercorn sauce and Creme brûlée .  The food was scrumptious except the Creme brûlée it was a little over cooked like the eggs are scrambled ... not a fan . The sorbet my girlfriend got apricot Chardonnay was exceptional . Check them out ! I will have to go back and try the pork chops next as they apparently are even better
author: Gretchen J.

description:
For an amazing late night supper, this is where you want to be!

Authentic French bistro style cuisine does not disappoint at 10:00pm stumbling over from Dobbs Ferry  !

The two of us shared garlic sizzling hot escargot, an unbelievably packed Salad Nicoise with perfectly seared ahi tuna and haricot verts, moules thai style swimming in garlic, chilis, lemongrass and coconut milk.  And the showstopper:  a perfect creme brûlée.

Of course, what could be better than a flute of rose champagne !

Service was spectacular as they let us close the place down at midnight!

Will be back!
author: Charlie B.

description: Best crepes in town. Very few places in San Francisco do buckwheat crepes. This is one of those places I go to after Ticouz closes - SF crepe lovers you know what I am taking about when I say ticouz. Everything here is soooo tasty, sangria to crepes to burgers. Plus you can walk around and checkout the awesome boutiques in Hates valley after.
author: Saf A.

description:
An okay choice for dinner. Portions are large enough that if you order the right things it won't break the wallet.
I got a the smoked salmon crepe. It was much larger than anticipated although it was 80% wilted spinach inside so it's technically healthy... right? The salmon itself was a bit too cooked through for my taste.  The buckwheat crepe however was very nice and filling. I probably wouldn't get it again just because I personally did not love the combination of spinach and salmon, but I have high hopes for the other crepes. 
We also got the Chez Maman burger which was great bang for the buck. It came with tomatoes, lettuce, and most importantly caramelized onions!!  The burger was pretty good--not bad but clearly not the most amazing burger either.  The aioli that the fries came with was amazing though. Next time I'd just get a full side order of the fries yum yum. 
Food aside, I was not happy with the service. It took almost half an hour after being seated just to get some water.  It's like they didn't even see us. We came at the end of the night and I could see several waiters dallying at the bar so I know it wasn't because they were over capacity.
Overall, not terrible but not hype level awesome.  I'd come here again but I'm not in a rush to.
author: Amy X.

description:
A cute French restaurant in Hayes Valley with delicious food and exceptional service!  The quality of food is amazing - everything I have ordered from here has been great! My favorites include the mussels, fresh onion soup, and the steak. The truffle oil mac and cheese was also flavorful and good.

But be prepared to wait a long time for a table, especially during peak dinner hours or on weekends. The restaurant is very small, so it may be best to come in a small group (around 4 people). Parking shouldn't be too hard to find, as there are a lot of spaces on the street around the area. Would definitely come back!
author: Kathy C.

description:
Went on Thursday. Pretty busy, but we were seated within 20 minutes. Got our bread and ordered drinks and appetizer pretty quickly. Bread was very tough, but butter saved it. 

We went through the whole basket and waited to order. After about 30 minutes, we flagged someone down to order. I got a chicken and Brie sandwich, BF got a burger with egg and cheddar. They came out on ciabatta, so I'd call it more of a sandwich. 

Fries were delicious, especially with the aioli! Wish I hadn't eaten 2 hard bread baskets while waiting to order or food to arrive, because I would have enjoyed eating all the fries. 

Overall, a fancy feeling restaurant at decent prices, but with services that forgets you.
author: A G.

description:
Sancerre was delicious!

Nicoise salad with tuna:  long, thin slices of raw, seared tuna served atop crunchy romain, tomatoes, potatoes and french green beans, dressed with a vinaigrette and accompanied by a ramekin of black olive tapenade.

Raw tuna is not easy to cut when served on a high bed of greens, and it's texture did not provide the correct "bite" with the rest of the crunchy and firm ingredients of the salad.  Cooked tuna would have been easier to eat in both regards.  Likewise, the tapenade, altho good, was an unnecessary complication whereas a hand full of olives I could spear on my fork would have sufficed efficiently.
author: Sondra H.

description:
Came on a Monday for lunch and sat at the bar. Ordered an espresso, the les moules frites with garlic white wine sauce and the beef tartare. The espresso was good! The mussels were also yummy and tasted as expected: garlicky and buttery, not too heavy. Portion size was good for 2 to share. The frites were v soggy and sad. :-( I expected the beef tartare to have a fresher taste. We sprinkled salt and pepper to wake up the flavor and it tasted good. Had a bite of my bro's pork chop - meh, a little dry. 

The space was small and intimate. It started to get crowded but not too crazy for lunch. Our server was kind and gave us lots of time to chat without interruption. The runners seemed grumpy. I might come back for a crepe. I will admit that I wasn't wow'd by the food, I did enjoy their music (outKast) and ambience. Side note: you do need to have your entire party present to be seated. Be on time for group gatherings!!!
author: Carina L.

description: French onion soup and frisée salad with poached egg and lardons were both delicious. The Chablis paired well with that.
author: Laura D.

description:
EXCELLENT! 

Stumbled upon this little gem the other night. Great service, kind staff and excellent food! 
Everything was fresh and cooked just right, and the food came out super quick too!
The prices are very reasonable. Nice wine and beer selection

I'd definitely recommend this place for dinner. 

I have yet to try their brunch which also looks amazing!

Will be coming back for more! :)
author: Natalie W.

description: Wonderful experience. Stopped here prior to seeing a SHN show. It is easy walking distance. A great place for French food with reasonable prices. Mussels were fresh and plentiful. We think there were 30 in a bowl but don't hold us to it because we were too busy eating them. Chicken was great and the Brest meat was boneless.  We ordered the Nicose salad to share and it came with a generous piece of salmon and a killer good ground olive spread.
author: Shauna f.

description:
yum yum yum!!!! HUGE PORTIONS, and very high quality food. 

had the 
+ burger (great portions + salad) 
+ mussels (lots and lots of it, so big couldn't even finish the whole bowl, plus fries w aioli on the side)
+ beef tartare (HUGE!)

will be a return customer!!
author: Cathy Y.

description: Went here before the theatre; was pleased with everything. The charcuterie was good( especially the pork pate). I had the sea bass with spinach and a nice mango salsa, the fish was cooked perfectly and the flavours worked well. The thing I loved the most is their take on a tarte tatin, the apple compote on top of a wonderful flaky and light pastry was just heavenly. We sat on the patio, it was a nice San Francisco night, the inside was quite warm and humid. Will definitely recommend this place.
author: Sal D.

description:
We came here for a light meal before a show and were promptly seated. The small menu had what we were looking for. Steak tartare and steak frite. A glass of wine. Mousse au chocolat and tarte tatin. Coffee. The usual steps of a common french meal, efficiently, if not perfectly, executed. The aïoli with the fries was a nice touch.

This place reminded us of a lunch we had in Paris a few years ago, Place St Michel. As then, the server speaks French. As then, our neighbors speak English. As then, it feels more like a very touristy place than a piece of authentic France.

If it were a movie, it would be "An American in Paris", not "Hôtel du Nord".
author: Denis A.

description:
Food:
Parmentier - definitely a good dish.  Very very cheesy but I don't tend to take some of it off.  Definitely tasty with the meat and mash!  
Burger - omg one of the better burgers I've had thus far.  Add brie and bacon and you are set!!!!!  One of the best u will have.

Service: very attentive and friendly 

Ambiance: a cool little local joint that you would go to if you lived in the area.

Overall:  when I'm in the mood for a burger I'm here!
author: Spencer Q.

description: Very tasty meal in great location! We came here for an early dinner and to enjoy the beautiful weather outside. Coming around 5:30pm we were able to snag a table for two outside. Our server was pleasant and offered quick service. We started with the escargot, highly recommend! This was delicious- garlic and buttery - great to dip bread into. Followed I had the pork chop- in a thick heavenly sauce (the pork - this I would have to say was my favorite part of the meal). My bf had the pasta carbonara which was also great! For dessert we split the chocolate lava cake, warm and gooey! Everything we had was delicious and I look forward to coming back!
author: Kayli G.

description: Came here specifically for mussels and it really hit the spot! I had the Thai flavor. Very generous portion and great flavor. Perfectly cooked. The broth was amazing I drank the whole thing. Nothing left!  was stuffed all night. I paired with Burt champagne. Decadent!
author: Xiu L.

description:
Nothing is as great as coming across a restaurant that you haven't heard of before (picked it based on YELP reviews) and enjoying every minute of the culinary experience.

On a busy Saturday night, the restaurant had a half hour wait, but we got seated in less than half hour. They have indoor, outdoor and counter seating. We sat at the counter and had a great time chatting with our server during the dinner. Most of the staff we talked to are French and are very helpful with great recommendations.

We had the beef tatar, French onion soup and the Tuna Nicoise for starters. French onion soup was probably the best I have tried and I highly recommend it. Nicoise was great as well, prepared will a slightly charred raw tuna and a great anchovy dressing. 

For dinner, we had the Thai Muscles, Mariners Muscles and the Veal w/ creamy mushroom sauce. All were a hit and prepared to perfection. For dessert with had the warm chocolate fondant and the cinnamon pain perdu. Both were great recommendations by our server. I personally thought the pain perdu was the best, it had a silky texture, light and flavorful. 

I highly recommend this place to anyone, we were a family of 3 and there were couples on a date, larger families and friends hanging out. Very comfortable atmosphere and really appreciated the warm and friendly staff.
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
True rating is 3.5 stars. Located in Hayes Valley, the decor and restaurant makes you feel like you are really in a french cafe, very cute hang out spot! It is kind of small inside, recommend sitting at the bar or outside.

We ordered:
Steak Tartare: Pass, the steak tartare I felt like was drenched in a ketchup sauce. I couldn't taste any steak flavor, just ketchup.
French Onion Soup: Recommend! Super delicious and cheesy. Loved every bite of it.
Eggs Benedict (Smoked Salmon): Pretty good. Can't go wrong with smoked salmon eggs benedict! The egg porn was too real. Comes with salad and potatoes.
Escargot: Pass, the escargot had no flavor at all. Probably wasn't fresh.

Overall, great brunch place. I had tried their crepes before and their salmon for dinner. It was pretty good also.
author: Natalie L.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place! I've been coming here for over than three years now. Mouss is the BEST as well as the entire Chez Maman crew! What a great service & delicious, absolutely amazing food! My fav is grilled salmon burger with add of avocado, mushrooms and goat cheese. And a few glasses of Rose! This place is A MUST visit when you are in the neighborhood. Highly recommended!!!
author: Kat Z.

description:
If you're looking for a casual, reasonably-priced date night restaurant, Chez Maman West is a good option. My boyfriend and I were specifically craving steak, but we weren't in the mood for an upscale $$$$ restaurant, so we settled for somewhere more laid back. When we arrived, we were immediately seated.

I ordered the steak entrée and substituted the French fries for garlic mashed potatoes. I loved the potatoes. They were so wonderfully garlicky! The steak, on the other hand, was an excellent cut but was way more overcooked than I had ordered. I asked for medium rare, but the steak wasn't the slightest bit of pink. So dry! Luckily it came with green peppercorn sauce, which I covered the steak in.

Service was good. The waiters were nice. I was a little annoyed that no one bothered to take our giant menus off the tiny table, but maybe they wanted us to keep thinking about dessert the whole time. Overall it's a good medium between more upscale dining and just eating somewhere just Olive Garden.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Great service, nice place.

I had a tasty panini with a great side salad
author: Flynn B.

description: Went out for Sunday brunch and had Egg Benedict with spinach and béchamel sauce. Staffs, services, and food are all great. Could be an option for the future visit if I have a chance to come SF again.
author: Tom S.

description:
I am salivating as I type this review. Bf and I came here on a Saturday ~3pm, when it seems like every other place was closed for a mid-afternoon break. There were 4 parties ahead of us on their sign up list, but the line moved quickly, and we were seated roughly 30 min later. 

Small place w limited seating. You'll get real comfortable w your neighbors. I asked around and it seems the restaurant is owned by a group of friends, who speak and communicate to each other in French. That was reassuring, as was the table next to us communicating in full French. (You know, similar to how you judge if a pho place is good...is it full of Vietnamese people?)

We tried:
-French onion soup
-veal
-pork chop w some pear/Apple thing, Brussels sprouts, and bacon. I mean holy cow, the dish on its own was delicious, but then they have to go and add bacon. Blew my mind.

I would highly recommend everything we tried. They also offer wines, beers, and other drinks. Service was fast and friendly. Highly highly highly recommend chez maman for a delicious, reasonably priced meal. This just made its way to the top of my recommendations for sf eats!
author: Michelle N.

description: Bead tartare was wonderful! (I wish I ordered the large size tartare..) Escargot was nice too. This place got a nice homy warm environment.
author: Sindy L.

description: The service was solid at Chez Maman.  However, the french onion soup came out luke warm which was weird and it really had no flavor [kind of watery]. The salad with the goat cheese was delicious, but I just wish the onion soup was more on point. Chez Maman, please add more seasoning to the soup and make sure it comes out hot! Kind of bummed as this place is usually very good on all aspects.
author: Justin F.

description: Love at first bite.  We have been going there pretty much one every week or two for about two years now. Staff is always very nice and the food is even better. I am a big fan of their savory crepes. Mussels are very good too. We love it here!
author: Pankaj C.

description:
I love mussels.  Clams...they are clams.  Oysters have their uses.
All I needed here was a glass of wine, mussels, and espresso-powered dessert.  My dining companion didn't enjoy the opera, but she forgave me because of the creme brulee.

Service was great...attentive, but not in your face.  Did I mention the mussels?

It is a bit loud, so take that into consideration.
author: E Z.

description:
Changing the flat iron to a New York strip bad move :( 
I have been a little disappointed with the output of this location def doesn't hold up to the standards it used to have.
author: Alandria S.

description: I really like this place. It has a pretty authentic French vibe. All the waiters are French. The escargots are so, so good. And the baked camembert is delicious! For the main dish, the veal was really tasty, and not heavy at all. The sauce was so flavorful. And the fries were perfect. We got the fondant and crème brûlée for dessert and it was really yummy. I would definitely recommend it! Try EVERYTHING.
author: Livia V.

description: Great food, ambiance, service....couldn't ask for anything more - except maybe reservations! Dinner here is first come, first serve. You put your name on the wait list and they call you when your table is ready. We got there at 5pm on a Friday and waited about 35 minutes for a table - not bad, especially if you are prepared for it and take a walk around the neighborhood. But GO! The food is pretty awesome!
author: Florence A.

description:
Normally they have a long line out since they do not take reservations. But if you get there before 6 pm, you should be able to get in pretty fast. I love their crapes. Made with buckwheat flour.
Very tasty and filling too.
author: Akiko I.

description:
Croque Mademoiselle was so so good. The egg was cooked perfectly sunny side up with a runny yolk. The salmon was extremely smokey and flavourful..

For dessert, my friend and I got the Apricot Chardonnay Gelato. It was amazing. One of the best gelato I've had. The flavor was very distinct and strong..
author: Jenny D.

description:
This is what France tastes like. I rarely go to french restaurants as they are always a disappointment. Most of them try to hard and miss the point of being a french brasserie: simplicity.
Chez Maman succeed to remind me of my country: decor and food is simple but on the spot. I had a croque monsieur, that can almost compete with my Dad's. The steak was really tender and fries came with a side of Aioli (a garlic mayonnaise).
I was full after my main, but got tempted by the desert menu and I didn't regret it: Crepe Suzette was one of the best I had (even better than some I had in Brittany).
author: Caroline L.

description: Very good and raisonnable price, I will come back for sure ! The crêpe Suzette is delicious.
author: Fannie F.

description: Lovely place for French cuisine in the city. Pork chops are superb and lamb is delicious. Most of all the crepes were prepared to perfection. Of course the service is over the top with friendliest staff. The ambiance was just right for cosy and casual intimate dining. Love this place and I would recommend it.
author: Nessa M.

description:
Came here for lunch before a performance of the Nutcracker yesterday.  It was just a short walk from the parking garage, and great food that brought back memories from my trip to Paris earlier this year.  
The food here is not the chic, expensive food that you might think of when someone says French food.  Rather, this is down-to-earth French bistro food, the type that French people eat for lunch -- the only thing missing that I expected to see was quiche!
I brought a bottle of sparking wine for us to share; corkage was $20.  We ordered the French onion soup and the baked Camembert to start, both were very good, although I would have preferred a softer bread to accompany the Camembert rather than the crunchy crostinis that they served.  We both ordered salads as our mans -- warm goat cheese for me, Nicoise for my friend.  Mine was made with arugula and sauteed onions with the goat cheese on top, and was very good.
My one regret is that we didn't get dessert.  The creme brulee, tarte tatin, and mousse au chocolat all sounded amazing, but we didn't have time.  The server gave us comped glasses of moscato to finish, which was very kind.  Looking forward to another opportunity to visit because the crepes were tempting as well!
author: Calee S.

description:
We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday and had to wait for awhile for a table, which was not a problem. Busy business means it's a good sign! 

But while we were waiting, the host was quite rude to everyone waiting for a table. She shouted comments angrily to the patiently waiting to get out of the way if the door, which she could have said much simply or kindly. Due to that reason, I cannot give this place more than 3 stars. 

The food was good. I ordered the panini, which was ok. However, the veal and striped bass my friends ordered were cooked very well.   The veal was topped with impeccable heavy and the fish skin was seated perfectly!
author: Wendy H.

description: Decided to try this place out on a Saturday night. The wait wasn't very long but there are plenty bars to grab a drink at if you need to wait. The onion soup is this insanely cheesey bowl of everything good! It does not have a strong onion flavor to it which was what I was afraid of.
